thread.title: What’s for tea at Grayshott Cricket Club?
thread.title_full: What’s for tea at Grayshott Cricket Club? - Telegraph

author: Gareth A Davies
title: What’s for tea at Grayshott Cricket Club?
text: Grayshott CC had described their duck rolls as crisper than Michael Vaughan’s cover drive and their pulled pork as being cooked slower than Geoffrey Boycott’s strike-rate. The club’s players make their teas, from savoury to sweet, on a rota system throughout the season. There were home-made sausage rolls and spicy chilli filets of beef on gem lettuce leaves Neil Sampson, the 2nd XI batsman, explained that the players “push the boundaries with succulently moist cupcakes iced with hand-crafted club emblems and a square cut of chocolate tray bake”. It was a lavish feast: egg and cress sandwiches; salmon and cream cheese wraps; bacon, brie and basil bridge rolls; pulled pork on crusty bread with a coleslaw and barbecue sauce. In addition, there were home-made sausage rolls and spicy chilli filets of beef on gem lettuce leaves. The cake stands were groaning with home-made savouries and a plate of colourful fresh fruit on skewers was quickly demolished. There was also an array of cupcakes, some designed as cricket balls, and many of them featuring emblems of the cricket club designed on rice paper. And to complement the feast, what else but huge pots of Yorkshire Tea? Find out more about the Yorkshire Tea Great Cricket Tea Challenge and meet the other Great Cricket Tea Challenge finalists » • Morton Colliery CC • Ebernoe CC • Bishop Thornton CC • Uffington CC • Newton Linford CC
